channel.title: Heed help
channel.description:
I need to know how to remove something that prevents my client from connecting to the server I downloaded. The source is Corby Xevolution and the client I am using is one of my own. His client connects no problem but when I try to connect to it with my client it does this,
[code]Connection from 192.168.1.101:2741 ClientHandler: Client null disconnected (192.168.1.101) Connection from 192.168.1.101:2742 ClientHandler: Client null disconnected (192.168.1.101) Connection from 192.168.1.101:2743 ClientHandler: Client null disconnected (192.168.1.101)[/code]
I will do whatever for someone to fix this. Please.

item.title: Heed help
item.dc:creator: @Zoft Zoft
item.description:
@Zoft wrote:

I know for a fact that there is something preventing me from logging in from a different client, I just can’t find it. I log in fine with the original client.

Read full topic

item.title: Heed help
item.dc:creator: @rangadanger7 rangadanger7
item.description:
@rangadanger7 wrote:

mine does this too, except im using the matching client except its my character that nulls, then resets.

Read full topic

item.title: Heed help
item.dc:creator: @TheCyberMan TheCyberMan
item.description:
@TheCyberMan wrote:

Try logging in with their client. If it works, you know they put an anti-leech so that you can only log in with their client.

Read full topic

item.title: Heed help
item.dc:creator: @Zoft Zoft
item.description:
@Zoft wrote:

I’m using a client I devoloped using SlashScape’s client as a base.

Read full topic

item.title: Heed help
item.dc:creator: @TheCyberMan TheCyberMan
item.description:
@TheCyberMan wrote:

Do they have a particular client? Sometimes these sources are coded to work on their client or they’ll disconnect you.

Read full topic

item.title: Heed help
item.dc:creator: @Zoft Zoft
item.description:
@Zoft wrote:

I removed all UID related things.

maybe it checks the uid?

item.title: Heed help
item.dc:creator: @Zoft Zoft
item.description:
@Zoft wrote:

I need someone who is good at removing this then, I will pay 5$.

Read full topic

item.title: Heed help
item.dc:creator: @TheCyberMan TheCyberMan
item.description:
@TheCyberMan wrote:

Again looks like an antileech…bummer. If this happens with all your sources, then something’s wrong with your computer.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Zoft Zoft
item.description:
@Zoft wrote:

No it doesn’t even let me connect, I hit connect to server and says error from loginserver and then it puts that in the run.bat.
